title: World Court To Begin Hearings That May Shape Global Climate Litigation
content: The United Nations' top court next week begins hearings on the legal obligation of countries to fight climate change and the consequences for states of contributing to global warming, the outcome of which could influence litigation worldwide.
summary: The United Nations' top court next week begins hearings on the legal obligation of countries to fight climate change and the consequences for states of contributing to global warming, the outcome of which could influence litigation worldwide.

title: Dozens Feared Dead As Boat Capsizes In Nigeria
content: Dozens of people were feared dead after a boat capsized on the Niger River in central Nigeria, a waterways agency spokesperson said on Friday.
summary: Dozens of people were feared dead after a boat capsized on the Niger River in central Nigeria, a waterways agency spokesperson said on Friday.

title: "Notre Dame Reconstruction Teams Did What Was Thought Impossible"
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday inspected the gleaming restored interior of Notre Dame cathedral, saying workers had done the "impossible" by healing a "national wound" caused by a 2019 fire that ravaged the mediaeval landmark.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday inspected the gleaming restored interior of Notre Dame cathedral, saying workers had done the "impossible" by healing a "national wound" caused by a 2019 fire that ravaged the mediaeval landmark.

title: Pics: Gothic Grandeur Of Notre-Dame Cathedral, Gutted By Fire, Restored
content: French President Emmanuel Macron praised on Friday the more than 1,000 craftspeople who helped rebuild Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral in what he called "the project of the century", five-and-a-half years after fire gutted the Gothic masterpiece.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron praised on Friday the more than 1,000 craftspeople who helped rebuild Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral in what he called "the project of the century", five-and-a-half years after fire gutted the Gothic masterpiece.

title: Asteroid Ryugu Sample Was 'Rapidly Colonised' By Earth Bacteria: Study
content: The sample from the asteroid Ryugu was overrun with Earth-based life forms after they were brought to the planet, scientists have concluded in a study.
summary: The sample from the asteroid Ryugu was overrun with Earth-based life forms after they were brought to the planet, scientists have concluded in a study.

title: As Thanksgiving Dish Turducken Trends, It's Link To NFL Legend John Madden
content: This celebrated dish was brought to prominence by NFL legend John Madden, football coach and commentator, in 1996 during a game between the New Orleans Saints and St. Louis Rams at the Louisiana Superdome.
summary: This celebrated dish was brought to prominence by NFL legend John Madden, football coach and commentator, in 1996 during a game between the New Orleans Saints and St. Louis Rams at the Louisiana Superdome.

title: Jocelyn Wildenstein Claims She's "Never" Had Plastic Surgery: Report
content: Jocelyn Wildenstein, the 84-year-old Swiss socialite known as "Catwoman" due to her extensive plastic surgeries, has denied getting any work done on her face.
summary: Jocelyn Wildenstein, the 84-year-old Swiss socialite known as "Catwoman" due to her extensive plastic surgeries, has denied getting any work done on her face.

title: How Germany's Patriot Air Defence Systems Will Protect Ukraine Via Poland
content: Germany has offered to re-deploy Patriot air defence systems to NATO ally Poland at the start of the new year, the German defence ministry said on Thursday.
summary: Germany has offered to re-deploy Patriot air defence systems to NATO ally Poland at the start of the new year, the German defence ministry said on Thursday.

title: Iran Reiterates Support For Syria As Jihadists Attack
content: Iran on Friday reiterated its strong support for ally Syria, where jihadists are waging a major offensive in the northwest of the country.
summary: Iran on Friday reiterated its strong support for ally Syria, where jihadists are waging a major offensive in the northwest of the country.

title: Russia Behind 'Staggeringly Reckless' Sabotage In Europe: UK Spy Chief
content: British security services have uncovered a "staggeringly reckless campaign" of Russian sabotage in Europe, that comes as Russia also resorts to nuclear sabre-rattling to deter countries from backing Ukraine, its foreign spy chief said on Friday.
summary: British security services have uncovered a "staggeringly reckless campaign" of Russian sabotage in Europe, that comes as Russia also resorts to nuclear sabre-rattling to deter countries from backing Ukraine, its foreign spy chief said on Friday.

title: South Korea Scrambles Jets As Chinese, Russian Warplanes Approach
content: South Korea's military said Friday it scrambled fighter jets as five Chinese and six Russian military planes flew through its air defence zone, an area wider than the country's airspace.
summary: South Korea's military said Friday it scrambled fighter jets as five Chinese and six Russian military planes flew through its air defence zone, an area wider than the country's airspace.

title: Chinese Man Shocked After Discovering 20-Year-Old Dice Lodged In Nose
content: A 23-year-old man in China who had been experiencing persistent sneezing and a runny nose was shocked to discover a dice lodged in his nose for more than 20 years.
summary: A 23-year-old man in China who had been experiencing persistent sneezing and a runny nose was shocked to discover a dice lodged in his nose for more than 20 years.

title: British MPs Debate On Legalising Assisted Dying
content: UK lawmakers debated whether to advance emotive legislation to legalise assisted dying for terminally ill people in England and Wales ahead of an expected vote on Friday, as competing protesters made their voices heard outside parliament.
summary: UK lawmakers debated whether to advance emotive legislation to legalise assisted dying for terminally ill people in England and Wales ahead of an expected vote on Friday, as competing protesters made their voices heard outside parliament.

title: Putin's 'Secret' Daughter Hiding In Paris Since Ukraine War: Report
content: Rozova had social media accounts, on which she posted photos of herself, posing and dancing. However, she deleted her accounts in 2022, shortly after Putin announced the invasion of Ukraine.
summary: Rozova had social media accounts, on which she posted photos of herself, posing and dancing. However, she deleted her accounts in 2022, shortly after Putin announced the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Spain Introduces 4-Day Paid Climate Leave For Workers After Deadly Floods
content: A month after floods killed at least 224 people, Spain has introduced "paid climate leave" for up to four days in a bid to allow workers to stay home during weather emergencies.
summary: A month after floods killed at least 224 people, Spain has introduced "paid climate leave" for up to four days in a bid to allow workers to stay home during weather emergencies.

title: Why India's Solar Mission Aditya-L1 Is Important For The World
content: NASA and space agencies of other countries have also been watching the Sun for decades. But the coronagraph on Aditya-L1 has a slight advantage over other missions' equipment.
summary: NASA and space agencies of other countries have also been watching the Sun for decades. But the coronagraph on Aditya-L1 has a slight advantage over other missions' equipment.

title: Sophie Rain: OnlyFans Model Reveals She Earns Rs 360 Crore A Year
content: Sophie Rain, a prominent model and influencer, revealed her remarkable $43.4 million earnings from OnlyFans, surpassing NBA star Jayson Tatums $35 million salary.
summary: Sophie Rain, a prominent model and influencer, revealed her remarkable $43.4 million earnings from OnlyFans, surpassing NBA star Jayson Tatums $35 million salary.

title: Viral Video Shows Pakistan Forces Pushing Praying Protester Off Containers
content: A video showing Pakistan's security forces pushing a man off a stack of shipping containers during a demonstration has surfaced online.
summary: A video showing Pakistan's security forces pushing a man off a stack of shipping containers during a demonstration has surfaced online.

title: "Concerns Over Extremist Rhetoric": India On Bangladesh Violence
content: India has conveyed its "serious concern" to Bangladesh over the "increasing incidents of violence" against the minority Hindu community in the neighbouring country. New Delhi has also shared its worry with Dhaka over the "surge in extremist rhetoric"
summary: India has conveyed its "serious concern" to Bangladesh over the "increasing incidents of violence" against the minority Hindu community in the neighbouring country. New Delhi has also shared its worry with Dhaka over the "surge in extremist rhetoric"

title: All About Nepal's First Transgender Candidates Running For Local Office
content: Two transgender candidates -- Honey Maharjan and Mouni Maharjan -- are contesting the by-elections to local bodies in Nepal. The voting in 32 districts across the Himalayan nation is scheduled for Sunday.
summary: Two transgender candidates -- Honey Maharjan and Mouni Maharjan -- are contesting the by-elections to local bodies in Nepal. The voting in 32 districts across the Himalayan nation is scheduled for Sunday.
